Introduction

BB GIRLS (formerly known as Brave Girls) is a South Korean girl group under BBGIRLS Company and GLG. Formed by Brave Entertainment as Brave Girls, they debuted as a five-member group on April 8, 2011, with the single album "The Difference". Brave Girls has gone through multiple lineup changes with the current lineup consisting of Minyoung, Eunji, and Yuna.

In 2016, after a 2 and a half year hiatus, it was announced that Brave Girls would be making a comeback as a seven-member group, with two original members (Yujin and Hyeran) and five new members (Minyoung, Youjoung, Eunji, Yuna, and Hayun). The group released a digital single titled "Deepened" on February 16. It was later announced that members Yujin and Hyeran, the two remaining original members, would stop promotions with the group in January of 2017. Member Yujin left for personal reasons while member Hyeran would take a hiatus due to health concerns. It was noted that no new members would be added and Brave Girls would continue promotions as a five-member group for the time being. Later that year, members Youjoung, Eunji, and Yuna participated in the idol rebooting show The Unit with only members Youjoung and Eunji passing the audition portion.

The group gained a sudden surge in popularity after their song "Rollin'" unexpectedly went viral in 2021. It was also revealed, by the member Youjoung, that they were about to disband right before the song went viral and the members had already left the dormitory when it happened.

After a few more years of promotions, Brave Entertainment announced the group's disbandment in February of 2023. However, on April 27, 2023, Warner Music Korea announced that the members had signed an exclusive contract with the agency to continue activities as a group. It was announced in May that they had changed their name to BB GIRLS due to Brave owning the trademark for the 'Brave Girls' name.
